    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(@NonNull
             java.lang.String address,
             @NonNull
             java.lang.String userIdentity,
             boolean bindOrLogin,
             boolean sex,
             int age,
             float height,
             float weight)
        Connect with device address. When the connection is successful, login or bind the device and do some basic settings for it. The difference between login and bind is that the bind will clear the data(steps,sleep,heart rate,etc...) on the wristband, and the login will not. The connection state will callback with observerConnectionState() The connection error will callback with observerConnectionError()
        Parameters:
        address - The device address
        userIdentity - The user identity. When converted to bytes with String.getBytes(), the bytes length must be less than 28. Parts longer than 28 will be ignored
        bindOrLogin - True for bind, false for login.
        sex - User sex info. True for man. False for woman.
        age - User age
        height - User height. Unit cm
        weight - User weight. Unit kg

      • close

        void close()
        Close the connection.

      • observerConnectionState

        io.reactivex.Observable<ConnectionState> observerConnectionState()
        Observer the connection state. Error/Completed event will never be send. The following is a sample code that determines the correct state in more detail. 
        
 ConnectionState previousState = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED;
 ...
 observerConnectionState()
     .subscribe(new Consumer() {
         public void accept(ConnectionState connectionState) throws Exception {
             if (connectionState == ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED) {
                 if (mWristManager.getRxBleDevice() == null) {
                     //If current is no cached device,must be close connection active
                     mStateTv.setText("Active disconnect");
                 } else {
                     if (previousState == ConnectionState.CONNECTED) {
                         //If previous state is connected, must be close by system error
                         mStateTv.setText("Passive disconnect");
                     } else {
                         //If previous state is not connected, must be never connected before.
                         mStateTv.setText("Connect failed");
                     }
                 }
             } else if (connectionState == ConnectionState.CONNECTED) {
                 mStateTv.setText("Connected");
             } else {
                 mStateTv.setText("Connecting...");
             }
             previousState = connectionState;
         }
     });
 ...

      • observerConnectionError

        io.reactivex.Observable<ConnectionError> observerConnectionError()
        Observer the connection error. Error/Completed event will never be send.

        Throws:
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleDisconnectedException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattCallbackTimeoutException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattCannotStartException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleServiceNotFoundException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleCharacteristicNotFoundException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleCannotSetCharacteristicNotificationException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleConflictingNotificationAlreadySetException
        AuthenticatedException
        OperationBusyException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        PacketDataFormatException
        AckException

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Is it currently connected
        Returns:
        true for connected, false for not

      • isBindOrLogin

        boolean isBindOrLogin()
        If the connection is successful, you can use this method to determine whether the current connection is login or bind. connect(String, String, boolean, boolean, int, float, float) connect(RxBleDevice, String, boolean, boolean, int, float, float) connect(BluetoothDevice, String, boolean, boolean, int, float, float)
        Returns:
        true for bind, false for login

      • getRxBleDevice

        @Nullable
com.polidea.rxandroidble2.RxBleDevice getRxBleDevice()
        Get the connected or connecting RxBleDevice. If the connection is not started or close(), will return null.

      • getConnectedAddress

        java.lang.String getConnectedAddress()
        Get the connected device address. If the connection is not established, will return null.

      • getConnectedDevice

        android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getConnectedDevice()
        Get the connected device. If the connection is not established, will return null.

      • getWristbandConfig

        WristbandConfig getWristbandConfig()
        Get the WristbandConfig. Connect successfully at least once, otherwise return to null.

      • setLanguage

        io.reactivex.Completable setLanguage(byte languageType)
        Set wristband language. Utils.getSystemLanguageType(Context)
        Parameters:
        languageType - 0x01 Simplified Chinese 0x02 Traditional Chinese 0x03 English 0x04 German 0x05 Russian 0x06 Spanish 0x07 Portuguese 0x08 French 0x09 Japanese 0xff Others
        Throws:

      • observerWristbandMessage

        io.reactivex.Observable<java.lang.Integer> observerWristbandMessage()
        Sometimes the wristband send message active. Use this method observer this type message. The emits value is: MSG_WEATHER MSG_FIND_PHONE MSG_HUNG_UP_PHONE MSG_CAMERA_TAKE_PHOTO MSG_CAMERA_WAKE_UP MSG_MEDIA_PLAY_PAUSE MSG_MEDIA_NEXT MSG_MEDIA_PREVIOUS MSG_MEDIA_VOLUME_UP MSG_MEDIA_VOLUME_DOWN MSG_CHANGE_CONFIG_ITSELF

      • openHealthyRealTimeData

        io.reactivex.Observable<HealthyDataResult> openHealthyRealTimeData(int healthyType)
        Testing healthy real time data.The testing duration is two minutes. openHealthyRealTimeData(int, int)

      • openHealthyRealTimeData

        io.reactivex.Observable<HealthyDataResult> openHealthyRealTimeData(int healthyType,
                                                                   int minute)
        Testing healthy real time data. The HealthyDataResult will result the testing value.If the type did't start, the corresponding value will be 0.
        Parameters:
        healthyType - HEALTHY_TYPE_HEART_RATE HEALTHY_TYPE_OXYGEN HEALTHY_TYPE_BLOOD_PRESSURE HEALTHY_TYPE_RESPIRATORY_RATE HEALTHY_TYPE_TEMPERATURE
        You can start testing multiple type at one time like this HEALTHY_TYPE_HEART_RATE|HEALTHY_TYPE_OXYGEN.
        minute - Testing duration(minute). Limit [1,255] minute.
        Throws:
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleDisconnectedException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleCharacteristicNotFoundException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattCannotStartException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattException
        OperationBusyException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        PacketDataFormatException
        SyncBusyException
        AckException
        TemperatureRealTimeException

      • openEcgRealTimeData

        io.reactivex.Observable<int[]> openEcgRealTimeData()
        Open ecg real time testing.The int array are divided into two different types of data. The first packet has a data length of 1, which is the sampling rate of ECG data. The data length of other packets is less than or equal to 10, which is the actual ECG data. Use this method start ecg testing and combining a complete ECG data. 
         EcgData mEcgData = null;
 ...
 mWristbandManager.openEcgRealTimeData()
         .subscribe(new Consumer() {
        Throws:
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleDisconnectedException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleCharacteristicNotFoundException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattCannotStartException
        com.polidea.rxandroidble2.exceptions.BleGattException
        OperationBusyException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        PacketDataFormatException
        SyncBusyException
        EcgStartFailedException
        AckException

      • observerSyncDataState

        io.reactivex.Observable<java.lang.Integer> observerSyncDataState()
        Observer the sync data state.

        The value less than 0 is reason of failed.The value here does not correspond to all errors. I think it may not be necessary. SYNC_STATE_FAILED_DISCONNECTED SYNC_STATE_FAILED_CHECKING_ECG SYNC_STATE_FAILED_SAVING_ECG SYNC_STATE_FAILED_UNKNOWN

        The value SYNC_STATE_START is sync start

        The value between 0-100 is sync progress

        The value SYNC_STATE_SUCCESS is sync success

        Returns:
